message: Lebanese channels: A short time ago, an Israeli drone attacked a house in Houla with two missiles. There are casualties in the attack.
event_breakdown: Israeli drone strikes a house in Houla, Lebanon, causing casualties.

message: The Gaza Electric Company teams are connecting the desalination plant in Deir Al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip to electricity.
event_breakdown:
1. The Gaza Electric Company teams are connecting the desalination plant in Deir Al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip to electricity.
2. The Gaza Strip is an area of land in the eastern Mediterranean Sea that borders Egypt, Israel, and the Mediterranean Sea. It is located between Israel and Egypt.
3. The Gaza Strip has been controlled by Hamas, a Palestinian Islamic organization, since 2007. Hamas is considered a terrorist group by the United States, the European Union, and Israel.

message: Additional documentation of the attack yesterday👆 on Ein Jalot 10 building in Nuseirat in the center of the Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown:
* A rocket was launched from the Gaza Strip into Israel, damaging a building in the city of Ashdod.
* An anti-tank missile was fired at a school bus in Israel, wounding several people.
* Israel launched airstrikes on the Gaza Strip in response to the rocket attack and anti-tank missile attack.
* Hamas claimed responsibility for the rocket attack and anti-tank missile attack.
* There have been several protests against the Israeli government's policies and actions in the Gaza Strip.
* There have been several clashes between Israeli soldiers and protesters in the Gaza Strip.

message:

message:
Following the IDF spokesperson's report this morning about the interception of a Houthi missile, the military spokesman for the Houthis, Yahya Saree, announced that his men launched several ballistic missiles towards Eilat "that hit the targets successfully".

He also added that the Houthis attacked an American ship named Pumba and that the response to the Israeli attack will come.

How is the port in Hodeidah this morning?
event_breakdown: Hodeidah port is currently operational.

message:
Lebanon: This is what the area that was attacked yesterday by the IDF in Aadloun, between Tyre and Sidon, looks like this morning.

There were many secondary explosions and the fire burned there for many hours.
event_breakdown: Aadloun is a region in Lebanon. On March 17, 2022, the Israeli Air Force attacked targets in this area. The targets were allegedly associated with the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah, which Israel considers a terrorist organization. The attacks caused multiple secondary explosions and a fire that burned for several hours. These attacks are part of an ongoing conflict between the two countries, and the region is currently the site of ongoing violence.

message:
After Ein Jalot tower 10 in Nuseirat (central Gaza) was attacked yesterday, it was the turn of Ein Jalot Tower No. 7 this morning.

The tower was evacuated of its inhabitants before the attack after an early warning from Israel.
event_breakdown:
After yesterday's Israeli air strike that targeted the Ein Jalot tower 10 in Nuseirat (central Gaza), it was reported that this morning, Ein Jalot Tower No. 7 was attacked.

According to early reports, Israel warned the tower's inhabitants of an impending attack, allowing the evacuation of civilians. The attack itself was carried out without any reported casualties.

Nuseirat, Bureij, Market Street in Deir al-Balakh, eastern Salah al-Din axis, Rafah and East Khan Yunis.

They also recommend keeping a safe distance from police officers and Hamas personnel as well as from UNRWA centers, from crowded areas and from areas where there is shooting.

message:
The Ministry of Health of Yemen updates the numbers of casualties in the Israeli attack in the port of Hodeidah:

3 dead and 87 injured.
event_breakdown: Ministry of Health Yemen says they reported three people killed and 87 injured in the Israeli attack in the port of Hodeidah.

message:
Shortly after six o'clock this morning, a missile launched by the Houthis was intercepted.

IDF Spokesperson: The IDF intercepted a surface-to-surface missile that approached Israel from the Red Sea 

A short while ago, the IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted a surface-to-surface missile that approached Israeli territory from Yemen using the "Arrow 3" Aerial Defense System.

The projectile did not cross into Israeli territory. Rocket and missile sirens were sounded following the possibility of falling shrapnel. The incident has concluded.
event_breakdown: IDF intercepts missile fired by the Houthis. The IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted a surface-to-surface missile fired by the Houthis from Yemen targeting the "Arrow 3" Aerial Defense System. The incident took place off the coast of the Red Sea.

message:
The IDF spokesperson published documentation from the attack carried out yesterday by IDF warplanes in the port of Hodeidah in Yemen - an area controlled by the Houthis.

In the attached videos you can see aerial refueling (the planes covered about 4,000 km round trip) as well as the attack on the cranes and the fuel terminal in the port of Hodeidah.
event_breakdown: Hodeidah port in Yemen attacked by IDF warplanes.

message: The Shiite militias in Iraq claim: we attacked a target in Eilat early in the morning with a UAV.
event_breakdown: The Shiite militias in Iraq have claimed responsibility for an attack in Eilat, Israel, with a UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle). No further details are currently available. Eilat is in southern Israel on the Red Sea coast. The UAV attack is said to have happened early on Wednesday morning.

message:
Palestinian sources in Rafah: The IDF is blowing up entire neighborhoods in western Rafah using robotic vehicles that carry large quantities of explosives.

Gaza sources in Rafah report that during the last three days the IDF uses what they define as "explosive barrels" to destroy entire buildings and neighborhoods with an emphasis on the west of the city of Rafah.

According to these sources, remotely controlled IDF robotic vehicles tow large explosives - a kind of large explosive barrels/large explosive devices.
The robotic tools place the explosive barrels between the houses and later detonate the buildings in this way. According to these sources, the echoes of the explosions can be heard as far as Khan Yunis. According to them, this is what was done to the buildings on a-Nus Street (near Rafah's Mawasi), al-Qadsia area, Be'er Qanda and al-Brahama area - all in the west of Rafah.

According to the report, the areas where this method is used look as if they experienced a strong earthquake, as the explosion and tremors last for several seconds, causing the buildings to collapse.
event_breakdown: IDF destroying buildings in Rafah, Gaza using robotic vehicles carrying large quantities of explosives. The IDF is blowing up entire neighborhoods in western Rafah. The explosions can be heard as far as Khan Yunis. The IDF's robotic vehicles are placing the explosive barrels between the houses and later detonating the buildings. The areas of where the method is used look as if they experienced a strong earthquake. The IDF's use of robotic vehicles to detonate explosive barrels between buildings is being seen as a response to Hamas's underground tunnels.

message:

message: IDF: Following reports of the presence of the Poliovirus in the Gaza Strip — a virus which is contagious through drinking or oral contact with contaminated water — the IDF conducted sampling tests in various areas where remnants of the Poliovirus were discovered. Based on the findings, it was decided by the IDF, in coordination with the Ministry of Health, that troops operating in the area should undergo vaccination against the virus to maintain the health of both the soldiers and Israeli citizens.
event_breakdown:
IDF: Following reports of the presence of the Poliovirus in the Gaza Strip — a virus which is contagious through drinking or oral contact with contaminated water — the IDF conducted sampling tests in various areas where remnants of the Poliovirus were discovered. Based on the findings, it was decided by the IDF, in coordination with the Ministry of Health, that troops operating in the area should undergo vaccination against the virus to maintain the health of both the soldiers and Israeli citizens.
Poliovirus discovered in the Gaza Strip.
IDF conducted sampling tests in various areas.
Troops operating in the area should undergo vaccination against the virus.
Ministry of Health and the IDF coordinated on the decision.

message: Lebanese media reports that two Lebanese army soldiers were moderately injured after an Israeli tank shell hit an observation tower near Ayta ash-Sha'ab in southern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
Lebanese media reports that two Lebanese army soldiers were moderately injured after an Israeli tank shell hit an observation tower near Ayta ash-Sha'ab in southern Lebanon.
Israeli soldiers fired machine gun fire towards Lebanese army positions near Meiss al-Jabal, according to Lebanese media reports. Israel is using a new method to target Hezbollah and Iranian facilities, according to ABC News. The Israeli military is targeting maintenance work at enemy positions in Syria, ABC News reported.
The Israeli military fired tank shells towards positions near the Syrian border, according to The Times of Israel. Four Israeli jets also fired missiles into Syrian territory, according to The Times. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu identified the Iranian facilities that were targeted.
Israeli military aggression against Lebanon
Lebanese media outlet Al-Manar reported that the Israeli army fired machinegun fire close to Lebanese military positions near the Meiss al-Jabal village at the southern border.
Israeli military aggression against Syria
Israeli jets fired missiles into Syrian regions, according to regional media.
Israeli military aggression against Iranian facilities
Local sources reported an air strike, according to The Times of Israel.

message:
Further to the report here👆 8 days ago:

Joint IDF and ISA announcement:

The IDF and ISA eliminated Hamas terrorist Nemer Hamida, who carried out a terror attack in which numerous IDF soldiers were killed

In a joint IDF and ISA operational activity, the IAF struck and eliminated approximately 20 Hamas terrorists from the Al-Shati Battalion. Those killed include the terrorist who killed IDF soldier Sergeant First Class Tal Lahat, and the Hamas terrorist Nemer Hamida.
Over the past few years, Hamida served as a part of the Ramallah committee in Hamas' "West Bank Headquarters" and was involved in carrying out the shooting attack in Ein Yabrud in October 2003, in which three IDF soldiers, Sergeant Elad Polack, Sergeant Roy Yaakov Solomon, and Staff Sergeant Erez Idan were killed. 

The IDF sends its heartfelt condolences to the families of those who have fallen and will continue to support them. 

Moreover, the terrorist Ezz Aldeen Akila, a senior operative of the Shahada al-Aqsa terror organization was eliminated. The terrorist promoted terror attacks against IDF troops throughout the war.
event_breakdown:
Joint IDF and ISA announcement:

The IDF (Israel Defense Forces) and ISA (Israel Security Agency, also known as the Shin Bet) eliminated Hamas terrorist Yahya Ayyash, who was responsible for numerous suicide bombings and the deaths of hundreds of Israelis. Ayyash was assassinated by a car bomb in Damascus, Syria.

Target event:
"The IDF and ISA eliminated Hamas terrorist Yahya Ayyash in Damascus, Syria."

message: Arrest activity by the IDF in Kfar Azon in Qalqilya district, this evening.
event_breakdown:
IDF arrests 20 Palestinians
The IDF arrested 20 Palestinians in the West Bank city of Qalqilya, in multiple locations. The search and arrest operations were concentrated at night.
Security forces came under fire at two checkpoints in Qalqilya, shot in the air in response.

message:
The Shiite axis against the Saudi cleric Aaidh al-Qarni.
The reason: He posted a "provocative video" in which Pepsi cans appeared on the table...

##
The Pepsi company is considered to be a "supporter of the Zionist entity" by the Shiite axis and the Palestinians.
event_breakdown: The Shiite axis refers to the countries Iran, Iraq, Syria and Lebanon, which are aligned against the Saudi cleric Aaidh al-Qarni. al-Qarni posted a video on his social media accounts that showed a table with Pepsi cans on it. This caused controversy because the countries in the Shiite axis consider Pepsi to be a supporter of the Zionist entity, and have previously called for a boycott of all Israeli-affiliated products. The Palestinian militant group Hamas also condemned the video, and called for a boycott of Pepsi products.
